channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The story of geometry told by coins
item.description: arXiv:2512.24349v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In three articles published in CNJ in 2012 and 2016 , we discussed some links between mathematical sciences, coin minting and numismatics. This article is a continuation of this cycle. It tells the story of selected important developments in the history of geometry using modern commemorative coins as a background and illustration.
item.dc:creator: Henryk Fuk\'s

item.title: On the Picard-Lindel\"of Argument and the Banach-Caccioppoli Contraction Mapping Principle
item.description: arXiv:2512.24283v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The aim of this note is to present the simple observation that a slight refinement of the Contraction Mapping Principle allows one to recover the precise convergence rate in the Picard-Lindel\"of Theorem.
item.dc:creator: Alexander I. Bufetov, Ilya I. Zavolokin

item.title: Mathematical Analysis 1 (Chapters in Univariate Real Analysis)
item.description: arXiv:2508.19405v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Preliminary version of a course in univariate real analysis, with 14 chapters and 1 appendix (Chapters 1-8 complete at present). 1. Infinite sums. Real numbers; 2. Limits of sequences and subsequences; 3. Arithmetic of limits. AK series; 4. Infinite series. Elementary functions; 5. Limits of functions. Asymptotic notation; 6. Continuous functions; 7. Derivatives; 8. Applications of mean value theorems; 9. Taylor polynomials and series. Real analytic functions; 10. Primitives of uniformly continuous functions; 11. Newton integral. Primitives of rational functions; 12. Riemann integral. Transcendence of the number e; 13. Riemann integral. Henstock--Kurzweil integral; 14. More applications of Riemann integral and A. Solutions to exercises.
item.dc:creator: Martin Klazar
